entry.dcterms:description: the survey examined, among Roma who integrated into mainstream society, what capitals they used, what integration strategies they chose, how their identity changed, and what conflicts they had to face as Roma; main topics: social situation, social mobility, ethnic identity, ethnic socialization, perception of success, characterization of the relationship between majority and minority

The basic population includes successful Roma persons (criteria for the selection were at least qualification as skilled worker and permanent job or source of living). The type of sampling was a snow ball method started from 22 starting points, during which only those were oncluded in the sample who were willing to answer. Consequently, the sample cannot be regarded as a representative sample.
